DefaultEvent.Description:
Delicate bottles lowered down chimneys on a rope. DO NOT FOLD UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE letters curled through a narrow slot. Rattling, groaning crates brought back to the same address every day for twenty-two days running. The windows they pried open, the servants they bribed, the delivery surcharges they paid out of their own salaries just to get rid of one more packet.

It is hard to tell which they hate more: the senders of mail, or the recipients. "Stands to reason, if the message was a welcome one, they'd tell the other fellow in person," reflects the Hairless Postwoman.
DefaultEvent.Name: Amazing what you get for a penny stamp

ChildBranches.Name: 配達員の大げさな物語に耳をそばだてる@{I}Listen in on postal tall tales
ChildBranches.Description: 釣り人が逃した魚の自慢話をするように、郵便配達員は厄介だった配達の話をするものだ。@{I}Fishermen brag about fish that got away. Postmen brag about hard deliveries.

DefaultEvent.Description:
The Hairless Postwoman at the end of the bar smiles mirthlessly; or maybe it's just the lack of eyebrows that does it. "Long enough carrying the things around, you get into the habit," she says. 

Then she tells you that if you stay out late enough, you'll see some of the postmen making a procession to the centre of the island, stringing up rats around the statue like Yuletide decorations, in prayer to an ancient deity of this place. 

From the coughing and choking elsewhere in the pub, you'd guess this is a story they often tell to newcomers.
DefaultEvent.Name: 希少さの問題ではない@{I}Scarcity is not an issue

ChildBranches.Name: なぜ地元の通貨がネズミなのか尋ねる@{I}Ask why the local currency consists of rats
ChildBranches.Description: ネズミの繋がれた紐が二本でエール一杯。三本でワイン。五本出せば、バーの下からかなり良いブランデーが出てくる。@{I}Two strings of rats for a pint of ale. Three strings for wine. Five for the tolerable brandy under the bar.

DefaultEvent.Description:
$Nuncio -> ナンシノウ$"No," she says. Curt, not pleased you asked. "Still had eyebrows when I came to Nuncio."

The postman at the next bench diverts you, speaks in a low voice. "Lots of people find habits when they can't deliver the post any more. This one has a plucking habit. Best learn not to notice."

You glance up. The Hairless Postwoman is still glaring at you.
DefaultEvent.Name: Faux pas

ChildBranches.Name: 髪のない女郵便配達員に、どうして髪がないのかを尋ねる@{I}Ask why the Hairless Postwoman is hairless
ChildBranches.Description: 驚くほど爆発性の高い郵便物か何かを取り扱った後遺症だろうか？@{I}Legacy of some interestingly explosive package, maybe?

DefaultEvent.Description: 「ああ、あれか。あれは俺たち全員、みたいな？この島の魂というか」彼らのほとんどは、わざわざそれ以上の説明を加えるつもりはなさそうだった。けれど、髪のない女郵便配達員があなたに教えてくれたところによると、あの像は、昔からずっとフォールン・ロンドンの郵便配達員にそっくりだったわけではないという。それはかつては違う顔を持っていて、衣服も時代遅れのものを着ていたのだそうだ。@{I}$Fallen London -> フォールン・ロンドン$"Oh, that. It's all of us, isn't it? Sort of the spirit of the island." Most of them don't seem troubled for more of an explanation than that. Though the Hairless Postwoman tells you it didn't always look like a Fallen London postman at all: that it used to have a different face, and a more old-fashioned outfit.
DefaultEvent.Name: 堂々たる配達員@{I}The monumental postman

ChildBranches.Name: 島の中心にある巨大な像について尋ねる@{I}Ask about that big statue in the center of the island
ChildBranches.Description: 仮に旅人向けのガイドブックでもあれば、あの像は一番に取り上げられているはずだ。@{I}If there were a guidebook for visitors, it would have to be the first entry.

DefaultEvent.Description:
彼らの語る物語の始まりは様々だ。退屈や失望をきっかけとするもの。あるいは、一回の誤配達で罪の意識に押しつぶされてしまった男の話。しかし、それらの話は、常に同じ結末を迎える。月日を経て積み上がる、配達不能の手紙と小包。それら配達不能の郵便物を、机の中やかばんの底に押し込んで無視しようとする試み。そして、ますます募りゆく強迫観念。
　とうとう、決意を固める。この衝動を満たすためにナンシノウに行き、ついに配達不能の残骸とおさらばするのだ。
　郵便配達員たちが配達不能の手紙をここに運んでくるのではなかった。手紙の方が、配達員をここに連れてくるのだ。@{I}$Nuncio -> ナンシノウ$Their stories have different beginnings - boredom, frustration, a fellow who was overwhelmed by guilt after a misdelivery - but they always end the same way. Undeliverable letters and parcels accumulating over months and years. Attempts to ignore the undeliverable, to shove it into a desk or carry it in the bottom of the bag. An increasing preoccupation with these items. Finally, a decision: to meet the compulsion, to go to Nuncio and be rid at last of the remnants. The postmen do not bring the dead letters to Nuncio. The letters bring the postmen.
DefaultEvent.Name: 不幸せな配達員はみんな同じ@{I}All unhappy postmen are alike

ChildBranches.Name: 郵便配達員たちがどうしてここにやってきたのか尋ねる@{I}Ask why the postmen came here
ChildBranches.Description: 彼らは、ここで休暇を過ごしているという雰囲気ではない。@{I}You don't get the impression they're making a holiday of it.

DefaultEvent.Description: 町の中心の大きな建物。そうそう見逃すことはない。望むならば、そこで働いても構わない。それが寛容な申し出だったのか、それとも脅しだったのかは、はっきりとはしなかった。@{I}Big building, centre of town. Hard to miss. You can work there too, if you want. It's not clear whether this is a generous offer or a threat.
DefaultEvent.Name: 配達不能郵便局@{I}Dead Letter Office

ChildBranches.Name: 皆が一日をどのようにして過ごしているのかを尋ねる@{I}Ask how they all occupy themselves all day
ChildBranches.Description: ここにいるだけというわけではないはずだが……？@{I}There must be more than this...?

DefaultEvent.Description:
彼女は最初、あなたの言うことをまったく信用しなかった。間違いなく実在する(少なくとも、あなたがロンドンを離れる時には実在した)建物の住所が、いかにはっきりと書かれているかを示しても駄目だった。
　とうとう理解した彼女は、あなたの頬にキスをした。そして、手提げかばんの中から、紐で繋がれたネズミと数デッキのカードを放り捨てると、新しい中身に詰め替えた。そして、彼女は突堤へと消えた。
「結局はまた戻ってくるよ」扉のそばの年老いた男が呟いた。それでも、もしかしたら、そうはならないかもしれない。@{I}She doesn't believe you at first, not even though you show her how the letters have firmly written clear addresses to buildings that definitely exist (or did when you left London, anyhow). Valid stamps. No delivery-failure markings. When she finally understands, she kisses your cheek. Then she dumps strings of rats and a couple of decks of cards out of her carrier pouch and fills it with the new material. Then she's off to the docks. "She'll be back eventually," mutters the old man by the door. Then again, maybe not.
DefaultEvent.Name: 五回目の説明で……@{I}On the fifth explanation...

ChildBranches.Name: 配達可能郵便物を配達員の一人に手渡す@{I}Hand off some deliverable post to one of the postmen
ChildBranches.Description: 彼らのうちの少なくとも一人にやり直す機会を、つまりはナンシノウから離れる機会を与えよう。@{I}$Nuncio -> ナンシノウ$Give at least one of them a second chance, a reason to leave Nuncio.

DefaultEvent.Description:
Everyone flinches when you open the sack.

The bartender speaks for everyone. "What's wrong with you, bringing that stuff here? Take it around to the Dead Letter Office! Wonder you can even carry it, what with the Pull."
DefaultEvent.Name: Take it away!

ChildBranches.Name: Show off your sack of undeliverable post
ChildBranches.Description: It's full of conversation-starting bits. Like this parcel with the bloodstains.

DefaultEvent.Description:
It gives off a lot of smoke, thanks to how water-logged it is, but the fire is hot and it does catch. Several of the postmen turn around to look at you and one of them is about to ask something-

But before the question forms, Blunt Thomas storms in, waving over arms and shouting at you. "Stop, stop stop! You're swamping the reassembly room!"

 
An hour later you're standing in front of a glass dome in one of the Dead Letter Office's back rooms. In the pure air under the dome, the letters are reassembling themselves, burning in reverse until they are whole again.

 
"You think we didn't try that?" says the postman on shift, staring gloomily at the pile. "It always turns up again. Whatever you do, don't ever bomb the post."
DefaultEvent.Name: Smoke

ChildBranches.Name: 配達不能郵便物を炎の中に投げ込む@{I}Throw your undeliverable post into the fire
ChildBranches.Description: 燃料の足しにはなるんじゃないかな？@{I}Might contribute to their fuel supply, eh?

DefaultEvent.Description:
$Fallen London -> フォールン・ロンドン$They're polite, even apologetic, about your request. You're welcome here, and welcome to take shifts at the Dead Letter Office, but you cannot wear the uniform unless you were a postal employee back in Fallen London. Regulations.

Blunt Thomas lets you have a look at his uniform jacket, at least. Neat stitching, gilded buttons, a thin but dignified circle of braid at the collar.

Inside, a patch that goes over the heart, stitched with six red letters. You can't read it, but it makes your eyes itch and your scalp feel like burning.
DefaultEvent.Name: Look but not touch

ChildBranches.Name: 制服を借りられないかどうか尋ねる@{I}Ask to borrow a uniform
ChildBranches.Description: If you're to fit in here, you'll need one.

DefaultEvent.Description:
$Nuncio -> ナンシノウ$It's the Pull, they tell you. Dead letters are like so many iron filings, drawn to Nuncio.

"See for yourself," suggests the Hairless Postwoman. "Go down to the shore, collect up a bunch of what's washed there, and you'll feel it soon enough."

"Saves time for the rest of us," says another voice. Apparently beach-scavenging is a civic duty hereabouts, like working in the Dead Letter Office.
DefaultEvent.Name: 引力@{I}The Pull

ChildBranches.Name: どうして手紙が浜に打ち揚げられるのか尋ねる@{I}Ask why letters wash ashore here
ChildBranches.Description: 誰かが知っているかもしれない。@{I}Maybe one of them will know.

DefaultEvent.Description: $Rubbery Lump -> ルベリー・ランプ$The parcels you've weighed and entered in log books. The things that oozed out of them. The postmen are delighted by your incredulity and shock. A civilian, finally understanding the full horror of the Post! They have stories even worse than those, let me tell you, hang on a moment, Postmaster Scritch, we've all heard your Rubbery Lumps story already, it's nothing to the Tomb Colony pickles, pickled what is what I want to know, what about that Soothe and Cooper crate and how we had to scrape the bits off the masonry do you remember... The night runs late.
DefaultEvent.Name: Common ground

ChildBranches.Name: Trade war stories about your shiftwork
ChildBranches.Description: You know how to fit in.

DefaultEvent.Description:
No one answers you. 

You repeat the question.

Finally Blunt Thomas says, "None of us've gone down there, and those that have, don't talk about it, and those that talk about it, we wish they wouldn't have, and they don't come back the same, and so that's an end to it and have another ale."
DefaultEvent.Name: Sudden inability to hear

ChildBranches.Name: 配達不能郵便局の奥の、鍵の掛かった扉について尋ねる@{I}Ask about the locked doors in the Dead Letter Office
ChildBranches.Description: 誰かがそこを通ったことがあるはずだ。だがどういうわけか、彼らはそのことをあまり話題にしたがらない。@{I}Someone must have been through, though for some reason they don't seem to discuss it much.

DefaultEvent.Description: Some smile and some laugh and some tell filthy tales, but at rest they all return to the same expression, downturned and bitter. It comes from being insufficient, and knowing that they are insufficient, and knowing that they will always be insufficient. They were called to a great task and they could not perform it.
DefaultEvent.Name: 当然の報い@{I}Unhappy by right

ChildBranches.Name: 今やあなたが知る事実に照らし、配達員たちを断罪する@{I}Judge the postmen in light of what you now know
ChildBranches.Description: 誰もが失敗したのだ。@{I}All have failed.

DefaultEvent.Description:
Nothing about them now seems comical or strange. The Regulation maintenance of their uniforms is a mark of holy dedication. Their scars are earned by faith and hard work. They were given an impossible task, but none excused themselves just because of that.

The Hairless Postwoman sees your glance and returns a rueful smile.
DefaultEvent.Name: 聖者であり殉教者@{I}Saints and martyrs

ChildBranches.Name: 今やあなたが知る事実に照らし、配達員たちを称揚する@{I}Honour the postmen in light of what you now know
ChildBranches.Description: 誰もが挑戦したのだ。@{I}All have tried.

DefaultEvent.Description:
You don't get far into your question before the Hairless Postwoman stands up and goes over to the fire, holding herself tightly. She is whispering, nothing coherent: "Fire. Clean. Smooth. Down to the bone. No excuse. Smooth, smooth. Little black hairs."

"Still your fool tongue," says Blunt Thomas.
DefaultEvent.Name: Perhaps not

ChildBranches.Name: 配達不能郵便局の地下洞穴について話す@{I}Talk about the caverns below the Dead Letter Office
ChildBranches.Description: 誰かが何かを知っているはずだ。あるいは興味を持つはずだ。@{I}Someone must know something, or be curious.

ChildBranches.Name: 突堤に引き返す@{I}Back to the docks
ChildBranches.Description: ひとまずは、ブロッターの暖かさから離れよう。@{I}Leave the warmth of the Blotter for now.

DefaultEvent.Description:
But you do get one taker. "I miss London," he says. "I'm tired. The inside of my mouth tastes like stamp glue."

Blunt Thomas gives you a bottle of rum and the use of the basement. "No amenities, but I don't fancy cleaning the blood off a better floor."

The patient takes off his uniform for the last time, and lies on the cold floor. "No spectators," says the Cladery Heir harshly, and puts you out of the room. She comes out later with a scrap of skin from the patient's chest. The patient follows, whistling a tune from Mahogany Hall.
DefaultEvent.Name: The Hairless Postwoman won't hear of it

ChildBranches.Name: Allow the Cladery Heir to offer her services
ChildBranches.Description: She could remove the Call from a postal worker. They wouldn't be a worker any more, of course.

Description: Lit by two roaring fires, one at either end of the room. The bartender is in postman's uniform, like almost all of the patrons. A noseless postal inspector called Blunt Thomas delivers the drinks, clears tables, stacks the firewood.
Name: インキー・ブロッター@{I}The Inky Blotter
